docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico is prepared to negotiate changes to the North American Free Trade Agreement to modernize the 23-year-old open trade pact grouping the United States, Canada and Mexico, Economy Minister Ildefonso Guajardo said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: NAFTA Needs to Be Modernized: Mexican Economy Minister
headline.main: NAFTA Needs to Be Modernized: Mexican Economy Minister

docs.lead_paragraph: Rescuers plucked around 900 migrants from boats in the Mediterranean on Friday while hundreds more were brought to Sicily, as Italian figures showed far more people are braving the crossing from North Africa this year than last.

headline.print_headline: Hundreds Rescued in Mediterranean as Migrant Arrivals in Italy Outpace 2016
headline.main: Hundreds Rescued in Mediterranean as Migrant Arrivals in Italy Outpace 2016

docs.lead_paragraph: Police in Democratic Republic of Congo said on Friday they had arrested the leader of a separatist Christian cult in the capital Kinshasa following a two-week standoff in which least six of his supporters were killed.

headline.print_headline: Congo Police Arrest Separatist Cult Leader After Violent Standoff
headline.main: Congo Police Arrest Separatist Cult Leader After Violent Standoff

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve policymakers who have recently signaled a pending U.S. interest rate rise are correct given the growing confidence and aggregate demand in the economy and stock market since the U.S. election, the Fed's vice chairman said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Fed Vice Chair Joins Effort to Flag Pending Rate Hike
headline.main: Fed Vice Chair Joins Effort to Flag Pending Rate Hike

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. short-term interest rate futures were little changed on Friday after Fed Chair Janet Yellen said that raising interest rates this month would be appropriate as long as the economy continues to improve as expected.

headline.print_headline: Traders Keep Bets on March Rate Hike After Yellen Remarks
headline.main: Traders Keep Bets on March Rate Hike After Yellen Remarks

docs.lead_paragraph: Austrian opposition parties setting up a parliamentary inquiry into the state's order for Eurofighter Typhoon jets 14 years ago have said they will seek to determine whether any kickbacks were paid to win the contract and to identify any officials who might have profited.

headline.print_headline: Austria's Greens and Far-Right Join Forces to Probe Eurofighter Deal
headline.main: Austria's Greens and Far-Right Join Forces to Probe Eurofighter Deal
